newsitem.title: USA: Boston Globe's top 100 Massachusetts firms.
newsitem.headline: Boston Globe's top 100 Massachusetts firms.

text.p: Companies in the retailing, high-technology, bio-technology and communications sectors were the best performers in Massachusetts, according to the Boston Globe's ninth annual rating of the state's top companies.
The survey put T.J. Maxx in the number one slot. The $6.7 billion fashion retailer, with stores across the United States, Canada and Great Britain had a meteoric rise, the editors said.
The Framingham, Mass.-based company, which was ranked 87 in the top of 100 of 1996, saw a 68 percent rise in revenues and a 146 percent increase in profit margin, the newspaper said.
The other top five Massachusetts companies are:
* Boston Scientific Corp of Natick, which makes medical devices
* Cascade Technology Corp of Westford, a computer networking products company
* Parametric Technology Corp of Waltham, a software firm
* Wyman Gordon Co of North Grafton, a maker of aerospace components.
